title.narrative: SWE-2010-121 The new developers? Circular migrants in policy and practice
SWE-2010-121 The new developers? Circular migrants in policy and practice

description.narrative: The development potential of circular migration (meeting labour needs in the North while the South benefits from remittances and the skills of those returning) is a focus of intense policy development in the EU/Sweden. Analysing policy and the empirical realities of circular migrants, the project elucidates conditions that promote or obstruct such development. Focus is on migration between Sweden and Bosnia, Cabo Verde, DR Congo, each with different migration-development potential. Critical policy analysis is wedded to ethnographic studies of mobile livelihoods, following 20 migrants and their networks from each field over 2 years. Migrant modalities: skilled/unskilled, gender and age. Methods: Interviews, policy analyses, observations (migrants and policy makers). The project grounds assessments of policy feasibility in substantial knowledge of migrants mobility strategies.
